channel.title: CNET UK Podcast
channel.itunes:subtitle: CNET UK Podcast
channel.itunes:summary: Britain's best technology podcast is beamed to your auditory sensors every Friday afternoon direct from CNET UK. The honey-toned team give you everything you need to know about the week's hottest tech news, the most Crave-worthy new gadgets and answer your best questions and funniest comments. There's a special feature every week, in which we tackle a burning tech topic in more detail, and lots more fun besides. Subscribe now, and let us know what you think!
channel.itunes:author: CNET UK
channel.itunes:keywords: cnet uk, crave, mobile phones, technology, gadgets, electronics, games, apple, cent uk, carve

item.itunes:author: Rich Trenholm, Drew Stearne, Andrew Hoyle
item.itunes:subtitle: CNET UK Podcast 265: Mini-Internets and apps within apps
item.itunes:summary: With Spotify becoming a mini-Internet for music and Facebook becoming a front-end for the web, what's the future of mini-Internets and apps within apps?

item.author: podcast@cnet.co.uk (CNET UK)

item.itunes:subtitle: CNET UK Podcast 264: Battlecruisers in the boozer
item.itunes:summary: We meet the gamers bringing the spaceships and battlecruisers of big-money Starcraft tournaments to your local boozer.

item.itunes:author: Rich Trenholm, Luke Westaway, Andrew Hoyle
item.itunes:subtitle: CNET UK Podcast 263: Future music
item.itunes:summary: It's an exciting time for music as Apple, Google and BlackBerry all launch online music services -- but a backlash is brewing against digital streaming.

item.author: podcast@cnet.co.uk (CNET UK)
item.title: CNET UK Podcast 262: Game on!
item.itunes:author: Rich Trenholm, Luke Westaway, Andrew Hoyle
item.itunes:subtitle: CNET UK Podcast 262: Game on!
item.itunes:summary: As the big-name games line up to do battle for your Christmas cash, we take a look at the future of the gaming world -- and ask if the smart phone has killed the console.

item.itunes:subtitle: CNET UK Podcast 261: Cybercrime and punishment
item.itunes:summary: It's CNET UK vs the cybercriminals as we discuss whether we need an Internet police -- plus the latest tech news.

item.itunes:subtitle: CNET UK Podcast 260: Will Nokia save Windows Phone?
item.itunes:summary: Can Nokia save Windows Phone, and can Windows Phone save Nokia? That's the question in this week's episode of the CNET UK podcast.

item.itunes:subtitle: CNET UK Podcast 258: BlackBerry BlackOut

item.itunes:summary: We pay tribute to Steve Jobs, the charismatic and visionary mastermind behind Apple.

item.itunes:summary: Insert coin and press start for the CNET UK Podcast! We're powered up to discuss the future of gaming.

item.itunes:summary: The Back to the Future shoes are real, and the CNET UK podcast is stuffed full of gadgets that prove we live in the future -- from the Samsung Galaxy Note to invisible tanks.

item.itunes:summary: Apple's prototype iPhone being abandoned in a tequila bar, Sony's crazy 3D headset, Samsung's new 7.7-inch Galaxy Tab and all the goings-on at IFA are in this week's podcast.

item.author: podcast@cnet.co.uk (CNET UK)
item.title: CNET UK Podcast 251: Sayonara Steve Jobs
item.itunes:author: Rich Trenholm, Luke Westaway, Andrew Hoyle
item.itunes:subtitle: CNET UK Podcast 251: Sayonara Steve Jobs
item.itunes:summary: Love him or hate him, Steve Jobs is always interesting. We debate what's next for Apple, and the chances of the HP TouchPad becoming a must-have hipster accessory.

item.itunes:subtitle: CNET UK Podcast 250: Is Android doomed?

item.author: podcast@cnet.co.uk (CNET UK)

item.itunes:subtitle: CNET UK Podcast 248: Smart phone dumb-down
item.itunes:summary: Ofcom says smart phones are cutting into our leisure time, but we say Angry Birds is the definition of fun. Is it time for a mobile intervention?

item.author: podcast@cnet.co.uk (CNET UK)
item.title: CNET UK Podcast 247: Newz kid on the block
item.itunes:author: Flora Graham, Rich Trenholm, Luke Westaway
item.itunes:subtitle: CNET UK Podcast 247: Newz kid on the block
item.itunes:summary: For the first time, an ISP has been ordered to block a pirate site. But you can't block the CNET UK team when we podcast the latest tech news and views.

item.author: podcast@cnet.co.uk (CNET UK)
item.title: CNET UK Podcast 246: The second coming of TV
item.itunes:author: Rich Trenholm, Luke Westaway, Rory Reid
item.itunes:subtitle: CNET UK Podcast 246: The second coming of TV
item.itunes:summary: The CNET UK podcast team grab the remote and channel-surf the latest news in the world of technology, from the MacBook Air and BlackBerry PlayBook to fighter jets and skydiving iPhones.

item.author: podcast@cnet.co.uk (CNET UK)
item.title: CNET UK Podcast 245: Discount me out
item.itunes:author: Flora Graham, Luke Westaway, Rich Trenholm
item.itunes:subtitle: CNET UK Podcast 245: Discount me out
item.itunes:summary: O2 Priority Moments has joined Groupon, Vouchercloud and a host of other coupon purveyors in a bid to part you from your cash. But are all these deals more trouble than they're worth?

item.author: podcast@cnet.co.uk (CNET UK)
item.title: CNET UK Podcast 244: Will Google+ murder Facebook?
item.itunes:author: Flora Graham, Luke Westaway, Jason Jenkins
item.itunes:subtitle: CNET UK Podcast 244: Will Google+ murder Facebook?
item.itunes:summary: You can't get an invite to Google+ for love nor money anymore, which just makes us want to use the would-be Facebook killer even more. But is it any good? We also sing Stevie Wonder's Happy Birthday and talk about the printer that prints in chocolate.
